SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.client.view
Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Board
public class Board extends Object
This class represents the board of the game as a matrix of items. It also contains:
  • itemBag: the bag of items
  • usableCells: the list of coordinates of the cells that can be used
  • extractedItems: the list of items extracted from the bag

    Modifier and Type

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Board()
    Creates a new square board of size boardSize and initializes: the bag of items; the list of usable cells; the list of extractedItems.
    Board(int numOfPlayers)
    This method: creates a new square board of size boardSize; fills the bag of items with every possible item; defines the usable cells in this board based on the number of players.
    Board(Item[][] boardMatrix, List<Item> itemBag, int numOfPlayers)

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int numOfPlayers)
      This method:
      • creates a new square board of size boardSize;
      • fills the bag of items with every possible item;
      • defines the usable cells in this board based on the number of players.
      Parameters:
      numOfPlayers - the number of players in the game

    • Board

      public Board()
      Creates a new square board of size boardSize and initializes:
      • the bag of items;
      • the list of usable cells;
      • the list of extractedItems.

    • Board

      public Board(Item[][] boardMatrix, List<Item> itemBag, int numOfPlayers)

    • getItem

      public Item getItem(int row, int column)
      Enables to get an Item from the board.
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the board
      column - the column of the board
      Returns:
      the Item in the specified position

    • getItemFileName

      public String getItemFileName(int row, int column)
      Given a row and a column, this method returns the name of the image file that represents the Item in that position.
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the board
      column - the column of the board
      Returns:
      the name of the file that represents the Item in that position

    • getBoardMatrix

      public Item[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Gets the board as a matrix of items.
      Returns:

    • getBoardSize

      public int getBoardSize()
      Returns the size of the board.
      Returns:
      the size of the board

    • fill

      public void fill()
      Puts all the Items in the usable cells of the board. It is used at the beginning of the game and when the board needs to be refilled.

    • pickFromBoard

      public List<Item> pickFromBoard(List<Coordinates> pickedFromTo)
      Used to extract a list of Items from the board.
      Parameters:
      pickedFromTo - the list of Coordinates of the Items to be extracted
      Returns:
      the list of Items extracted

    • atLeastOneFree

      public boolean atLeastOneFree(List<Coordinates> cells)
      Checks if all the tiles chosen have at least one free adjacent cell
      Returns:
      true if at least one cell is free, false otherwise

    • checkBorder

      public boolean checkBorder(Coordinates cell)
      Checks if the cell has a free side.
      Parameters:
      cell - contains the coordinates of the cell to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the cell has at least one side free, false otherwise

    • numberOfTilesLeft

      public int numberOfTilesLeft()
      Calculates the number of tiles left on the board.
      Returns:
      the number of tiles left on the board

    • isAlone

      public boolean isAlone(int i, int j)
      Checks if the tile is not surrounded by other tiles.
      Parameters:
      i - corresponds to the row of the tile
      j - corresponds to the column of the tile
      Returns:
      true if the tile is not surrounded by other tiles, false otherwise

    • allIsolated

      public boolean allIsolated()
      Checks if all the tiles left in the board have no tiles adjacent to them. It is used to see if the board needs to be refilled.
      Returns:
      true if all the tiles left in the board have no tiles adjacent to them, false otherwise

    • startEndNotNull

      public boolean startEndNotNull(List<Coordinates> cells)
      Checks if the start and end items are not null.
      Parameters:
      cells - the list of coordinates of the tiles chosen
      Returns:
      true if all the tiles chosen are not null, false otherwise

    • OrderAndMaxOf3

      public boolean OrderAndMaxOf3(List<Coordinates> cells)
      Checks if the distance between the tiles chosen is at most 3 and if the order is correct (ascending).
      Parameters:
      cells - the list of coordinates of the tiles chosen
      Returns:
      true if the order is correct and the distance is at most 3, false otherwise
